entry.title: Why do truckers wear cowboy boots? (Explained!)
entry.summary: You don't have to visit the range to see people wearing cowboy boots. These leather riding boots are a popular work shoe and are a favorite of truckers. This is more than just a fashion choice. Cowboy boots offer distinct benefits to truckers and other…
entry.content:
You don't have to visit the range to see people wearing cowboy boots. These leather riding boots are a popular work shoe and are a favorite of truckers. This is more than just a fashion choice. Cowboy boots offer distinct benefits to truckers and other workers.

That's not to say that cowboy culture hasn't had an influence on truckers. Many big rig drivers choose to wear cowboy hats along with their boots. Still, it's important to recognize that truckers have a good reason to choose cowboy boots.

Why Do Truckers Wear Cowboy Boots?

Cowboy boots are durable, warm, and have a snug enough fit to let truckers feel the vehicle's brakes as they're driving. A high-quality boot can also be incredibly comfortable, especially after the boot has been broken in. Over time, the leather on the boots stretch and perfectly adapt to the shape of the wearer's feet.

Cowboy boots are designed for manual labor, and that makes them a perfect fit for truckers. A good pair of leather boots can stay in great shape for years with minimal maintenance. Since most modern cowboy boots have a midsole system, they also keep your feet cushioned and well-supported, even when boots are worn for 10 hours or more per day.

Are There Any Benefits to Wearing Cowboy Boots While Driving a Big Rig?

Laceless boots, like cowboy boots, can be much safer for truckers than boots with laces. Laces can potentially become untied while driving. If this happens, they could become tangled around the accelerator or the brakes of the vehicle, which could be dangerous.

Aside from that, the right pair of cowboy boots will keep feet comfortable, which is essential when driving for long stretches of time. The wrong boots can give truckers blisters or callouses. Cowboy boots keep feet well-supported while still giving them room to stretch.

In addition, cowboy boots can help keep a trucker's toes protected. The brakes in big rigs are much heavier than brakes systems in standard vehicles. Cowboy boots with reinforced toes can shield the toes and protect them from injury.

Is It Illegal to Drive In Cowboy Boots?

It's legal for all drivers to wear cowboy boots in every state. Millions of drivers across the country work in these boots. In fact, cowboy boots have been growing in popularity with each passing year.

With that said, truckers should make sure they choose the right boots. Ideally, the boots should be lightweight with a rubber sole. Boots should also have low heels and plenty of room around the toes. Boots with round toes can promote blood circulation and keep feet comfortable during long drives.

What Is the Purpose of Wearing Cowboy Boots?

Cowboy boots were originally designed for horse riding. Today, they're still worn by workers in many industries thanks to the superior protection they provide. The long shaft of the boot protects the leg, while the low heel and reinforced toe help to keep the feet secure.

Each year, more than 53,000 workers suffer foot injuries that lead to missed workdays. That's why workers with tough jobs need to find footwear that will give their feet the protection that they need. Sturdy and comfortable shoes like cowboy boots are perfect for truckers.

Do Truckers Wear Cowboy Hats?

Cowboy hats have long been a part of trucker culture. While not all truckers will sport a cowboy hat when they're on the road, hats can be a way to protect your eyes from the sun's glare. In addition to cowboy hats and boots, it's common to see truckers sporting plaid shirts and denim.

Ultimately, truckers require clothing that's functional, durable, and comfortable. Certain types of clothing, like cowboy boots, are popular for a reason, but most truckers aren't required to wear specific types of clothing. Whether they wear cowboy hats, trucker hats, or something else entirely, today's truckers are free to choose the clothing that they feel is best suited for their job.

Final Thoughts

Cowboy boots are one of the best types of footwear for truckers. While some people assume that it's illegal to wear cowboy boots while you're driving a big rig, that's not actually the case. In fact, the right boots will protect a driver's feet while providing them with comfort and support.

If a trucker invests in the right pair of cowboy boots, they'll be able to rely on those shoes for years. Whether they opt to pair those boots with a cowboy hat or just wear them with a t-shirt and jeans, leather cowboy boots are a practical footwear choice that still has plenty of style.

entry.title: 7 Things To Know About Wearing Hiking boots vs cowboy boots
entry.summary: Boots come in many varieties. They’ve protected our feet and ankles from the forces of nature for centuries. Hiking and cowboy boots are no exception. Even though they share similar purposes, how do they compare with one another? In this article, we’ll discuss some similarities…
entry.content:
Boots come in many varieties. They’ve protected our feet and ankles from the forces of nature for centuries. Hiking and cowboy boots are no exception.

Even though they share similar purposes, how do they compare with one another?

In this article, we’ll discuss some similarities between the two, the differences, what functions they serve, and if they’re comfortable overall to wear.

What similarities do hiking boots and cowboy boots share?

They both protect your ankles from the elements.

If you’re one to splash around in the mud and muck, then either type of boot will serve your purpose just fine. Both are made with durability in mind, meaning they can take a beating and keep on going.

Since both a cowboy and hiking boot will fully cover your ankle, you’ll be able to walk around in puddles, snow, and anything else that your feet will sink into. It makes sense too, as these two kinds of footwear are used primarily for outdoor purposes.

Seeing how durable these boots are, you can also expect to wear either pair all day long. If taken care of properly, expect to have your boots last for several years on end.

What are the differences between cowboy boots and hiking boots?

Their construction materials.

Traditionally, cowboy boots are made up of leather. Hiking boots, on the other hand, are made up of synthetic alternatives such as GORE-TEX to make them more waterproof. They also contain some leather, but not nearly as much as a traditional pair of cowboy boots.

Even if both can be worn outside for long periods of time, their functions differ somewhat. Hiking boots are designed to handle some of the roughest terrain out there, whereas cowboy boots need flatter ground to work properly. This is due to the outer soles of hiking boots having better grip.

How do the prices of each boot compare?

Both are relatively the same.

With that being said, it also depends which pair you buy for either type. Some pairs might be made of higher-quality materials, and will therefore cost more. However, for those common everyday kinds of boots, both cowboy and hiking boots have an average range of 50 to 200 dollars.

Should you consider buying a pair of either, it’s up to you how much you want to spend. Do you want quality over everything else? Be prepared to spend triple-digit dollar numbers. In some cases, the best quality cowboy boots can exceed well over a grand!

If you’re not outdoors ninety percent of the time, then consider getting a cheaper pair of boots instead. If you won’t use your boots much, cowboy or hiking, then don’t be afraid to spend 50 bucks or less. That way you don’t have to break your bank account for durable footwear.

What functions does each kind of boot serve?

Different designs, different functions.

As it says in the name, “Hiking”, boots are intended for long hikes on uneven terrain. Seriously, consider getting a pair if you’ll be traveling on snowy, rocky, or even high alpine surfaces.

Cowboy boots, however, won’t do so well in those kinds of environments. Some complain about the lack of traction for what’s needed on hikes. As cowboy boots don’t have the grip that hiking boots have, it would be a bad idea to walk up a mountain with improper footwear. Even though cowboy boots are made to endure tough situations, they’re mostly intended for things like riding horses or working on a ranch.

If you break into them right, you can use either cowboy or hiking boots to walk long distances. One function that both types share is their ability to last long hours in the great outdoors.

How comfortable is either type?

It depends on the type you get.

How comfortable any footwear is depends on the size and shape of your feet, and how you use your boots. Higher-quality goods, no matter what kind of boot, tend to be a bit more comfortable than the cheaper alternatives.

With that being said, hiking boots overall tend to be more comfortable than cowboy boots. This comes as no surprise, considering what hiking boots are designed to do. Whereas some brands of cowboy boots come with cushioning, most won’t have too much of it. To make them more comfortable, you’ll have to consider buying extra padding for that bit of extra comfort.

What are some of the best brands for both hiking and cowboy boots?

There are several.

For cowboy boots, some brands to check out are Justin and Lucchese. Other quality companies also include Ariat, Rocketbuster, and Corral. These five brands are considered some of the best cowboy bootmakers around.

The top five hiking boot brands (as of 2022) are Zamberlan, Lowa, La Sportiva, Merrel, and Salomon. If you need footwear that will last an entire day of backpacking and then some, give each of these companies a look.

Final Thoughts

Whereas each kind of boot is great for wearing around outside, always keep the terrain in mind, as each type of footwear is designed to tackle different purposes. Which boot fits best for you depends on what you need them for. Shopping around for the best of either might seem like a headache at first, but now that you have a little more knowledge than before, explore a little bit!

entry.title: Cowboy boots vs dress shoes (Here's What To Know)
entry.summary: To walk a mile in someone else’s shoes, you first have to know what kinds of shoes are being worn in the first place. When comparing footwear, it helps to know what makes them different from one another. This is especially the case when comparing…
entry.content:
To walk a mile in someone else’s shoes, you first have to know what kinds of shoes are being worn in the first place. When comparing footwear, it helps to know what makes them different from one another.

This is especially the case when comparing cowboy boots with dress shoes. Whether you need function over form, or vice-versa, in this article, we’ll go into detail on what sets cowboy boots apart from their fancier dress shoe cousins.

When should you wear cowboy boots instead of dress shoes?

Pick cowboy boots if you’ll be spending a lot of time outdoors.

Ever since their inception in the 18th century, cowboy boots have been made primarily for comfort, safety, and durability.

Considering the rugged environments they had to endure at the time (and still do today), cowboy boots can last up to a whopping 10 years or more due to the leather they’re made of.

Cheaper brands, of course, will last less than that, but will still provide the same function and reliability in the short term.

Now, it’s easy to see why you wouldn’t wear dress shoes on the ranch in place of boots. For work like that, you’ll need something tough enough for the job.

Cowboy boots can also be used for formal events, provided you’re in the right place. Specifically, you’d choose cowboy boots over dress shoes if the formal event has a strong western theme to it.

Do boots count as dress shoes?

No, they don’t.

With that being said, it’s possible to get a fancy pair of "dress cowboy boots," but many agree that boots are more casual than dress shoes. For most formal events, go with dress shoes unless you’re expected to wear western things.

Boots are also very different from dress shoes structure-wise. A boot, by standard definition, is defined as a fitted covering (as of leather or rubber) for the foot that usually reaches above the ankle.

Shoes in this light have a shorter construction, with most having little to no ankle support depending on the type.

What similarities do cowboy boots and dress shoes share?

Both are fairly durable.

Similar to cowboy boots, dress shoes can last a long time, especially if the shoe in question is made of leather. However, not all styles of dress shoes are the same. The more durable varieties include:

  • Derby
  • Oxfords
  • Loafers
  • Brogues

Each of these types are “hand-stitched” and typically made of the same stuff that quality cowboy boots are. When quality stitching and leather are combined, you’re sure to get durable footwear no matter the style.

What differences do cowboy boots and dress shoes have?

Many.

Considering their purpose, cowboy boots are incredibly different from dress shoes. Whereas boots are better at function, waterproofness, and safety, dress shoes have the advantage of being more comfortable, more breathable, more fashionable, and slightly more versatile than their western-style cousins.

As mentioned earlier, if the function you’re attending requires you to be outdoors a lot, stick with cowboy boots as they will protect your feet way better than any dress shoe can.

They don’t necessarily have to be of the cowboy variety either, as several kinds of dress boots also exist.

When it comes to fashion, dress shoes are simply better in that department due to the huge variety of forms they come in.

This can also allow the wearer to look good in more types of environments than any pair of cowboy boots can.

How do cowboy boots and dress shoes compare in comfortability?

Dress shoes tend to be a bit better for this.

This is partly due to the freedom your ankles get when wearing dress shoes. With this feature, you get better footing, allowing you to avoid a nasty dislocation or ankle sprain.

With cowboy boots, you may be able to tuck your pants into the ankle covers should the need arise, but if you’re not used to wearing boots, you can expect your feet to develop blisters after a while.

This situation is all the more likely if the cowboy boots in question have tapered heels and narrow toes.

Another factor to consider is the breathability of cowboy boots and dress shoes.

Not only do dress shoes have more room for your legs and feet to cool off, but they tend to be made of less “water-resistant” materials, which is what cowboy boots need to protect the wearer from water and heat.

How do cowboy boots and dress shoes compare in price?

Dress shoes will be more expensive overall, whereas cowboy boots are more expensive on average.

Some dress shoes can reach up to the thousands of dollars depending on which pair you want to buy.

However, such pairs are top-of-the-line, whereas more casual dress shoes will typically range around 50 dollars for a decent pair.

When it comes to the average cost of cowboy boots, a quality pair will usually be more expensive.

Want a pair that will last you a decade or longer? Be prepared to dish out 200 to 1000 dollars. This depends, of course, which brand you go with, and other types of cowboy boots out there can be as little as 50 dollars.

Final Thoughts

Cowboy boots won’t fit for every occasion, but neither will dress shoes. Now that you have a bit more knowledge than before, pick whatever suits your footwear needs best.

entry.title: Can you wear cowboy boots to an interview? (Explained)
entry.summary: As a country person at heart, you may be wondering if you can wear cowboy boots to an interview. In this article, we will discuss whether you can wear cowboy boots to an interview, what kind of boots to wear to an interview, why someone…
entry.content:
As a country person at heart, you may be wondering if you can wear cowboy boots to an interview. In this article, we will discuss whether you can wear cowboy boots to an interview, what kind of boots to wear to an interview, why someone would wear cowboy boots to an interview, and how to wear cowboy boots with dress pants. We will also cover what color boots to choose for an interview and whether to clean your boots before the interview.

Can you wear cowboy boots to an interview?

The short answer is, yes, you can wear cowboy boots to a job interview–as long as they are dress boots that match your interview attire.

 

Additionally, it is important to shine and clean your dress cowboy boots beforehand to make a neat first impression.

 

What kind of boots can I wear to an interview?

Unless your work requires a specific type of boots–such as ranch work or manufacturing–dress cowboy boots in a matching color scheme to your outfit are the best option for an interview.

 

For very casual job interviews, you may be able to get away with wearing regular cowboy boots. If your interview takes place on a ranch and is related to a ranch position, regular cowboy boots might be the most practical choice. Don’t be afraid to ask an interviewer what dress or shoes they recommend for the interview.

 

If there is a skills component to the interview on a ranch filled with mud and horse manure, you may regret bringing your best boots. However, in an office setting or a corporate setting, taking the time to polish and clean dress cowboy boots can make the difference between scoring the job and receiving a rejection email.

Why would you wear cowboy boots to an interview?

You may want to wear cowboy boots to an interview because they are comfortable, stylish, and convey your personality in a bold way.

Plus, cowboy boots are always in season. Whether you are interviewing in the summer, spring, winter, or fall, cowboy boots will keep your feet comfortable. When you feel comfortable, you can stride into an interview with confidence.

Besides style and personal expression, cowboy boots might be the most practical choice for an interview in outdoor work, maintenance, manufacturing, or agriculture. Especially if you expect to work with livestock, cowboy boots are a natural choice.

Should you clean your boots beforehand?

You should clean your boots before the interview, regardless of what type of work you intend to get.

Even if you might get muddy at the interview site, walking in with polished boots gives the impression that you pay attention to details. An interviewer will undoubtedly take notice. When you put your best foot forward–pun intended!–you increase your chances of moving forward in the hiring process.

Although it is a seemingly small task, cleaning your boots before the big day shows that you have a work ethic and take pride in your work. Whether it feels right or not, the truth is, employers will take notice of this.

Wearing dress pants with boots

When you wear dress pants with boots, opt for either a leg that is wide enough to go over the boots or a leg that is tapered enough to fit into the boots.

Make sure that the pants are long enough to cover the ankles but not so long that they drag on the floor and risk getting caught under a cowboy boot’s heel.

What color boots should you wear to an interview?

The color of boots to wear to an interview strongly depends on the color of the rest of your outfit.

When in doubt, neutral tones like black, brown, gray, and navy are a good place to start. Avoid anything flashy like red or metallic-colored boots. Also, avoid complicated designs unless you are interviewing to work at a specialty retailer that sells designer cowboy boots.

It may also be best to keep white and cream boots in the closet on an interview day. After all, white and cream tones are a blank canvas for dirt and stains to occupy for the long haul. No amount of cleaning or shining can turn some light-colored boots back to their original clean slate. Plus, no one wants to accidentally step in mud minutes before walking into the interview and letting everyone see it on their boots.

For a professional look that is guaranteed to stay sharp all day, go for the darkest colored boots that will match the rest of your outfit. Beige and warm-toned interview clothes will probably match best with brown, whereas more colorful, bright interview clothes might coordinate better with blue or navy. Use your best judgment and know that while shoe color is important, it will most likely not make or break your interview experience.

Final Thoughts

In conclusion, you can absolutely wear cowboy boots to a job interview–don’t let anyone tell you differently! Just shine and clean the boots the night before the job interview, choose a dress pair of boots to stand out as a serious professional with personality (and stay comfortable), and choose dress pants that either cover the boots or tuck into them. For color, opt for boots that match the rest of your outfit and stay in a neutral color palette if possible.

entry.title: Can nurses wear cowboy boots? (Explained!)
entry.summary: If you’re a nurse who enjoys incorporating a country flair into your style, then you probably wonder if nurses can wear cowboy boots. In this article, we will discuss whether nurses can wear cowboy boots, whether nurses can wear cowboy boots with scrubs, whether nurses…
entry.content:
If you’re a nurse who enjoys incorporating a country flair into your style, then you probably wonder if nurses can wear cowboy boots. In this article, we will discuss whether nurses can wear cowboy boots, whether nurses can wear cowboy boots with scrubs, whether nurses should be wearing cowboy boots, what kind of cowboy boots a nurse would wear, and what areas of the U.S. allow nurses to wear cowboy boots.

Can nurses wear cowboy boots?

The short answer is, it depends on the individual nurse’s hospital policies, state policies, and personal comfort level.

In some cases, nurses are forbidden from wearing cowboy boots to work because they violate the dress code. Cowboy boots frequently have heels that exceed the height limit for nursing staff on the floor.

In their free time outside of the medical setting, nurses are welcome to wear cowboy boots. On the job, it may be a different story. Nurses should always consult with their supervisors before attempting to wear unusual footwear to work. Wearing inappropriate shoes can jeopardize the safety of the patients and the nursing staff. After all, the wrong shoes can cause slipping, falling, tripping, slowed mobility, and pain after being on our feet for a full shift.

If you work in a hospital where others openly wear cowboy boots, though, it may be a good indicator that your particular workplace and state approve of cowboy boots on nurses. In this case, feel free to rock your favorite cowboy boots on the floor.

Can you wear cowboy boots with scrubs?

As long as the scrubs are wide-legged enough to cover the boots and your hospital allows cowboy boots in the dress code, you should be able to wear cowboy boots with scrubs.

You may be tempted to tuck a more tapered scrub pant-leg into cowboy boots to show them off. We would not recommend tucking the scrubs into the boots because it could cause fluids to drip into your shoes. There are many reasons why this could cause issues for your health, safety, and comfort.

Should nurses be wearing cowboy boots?

We think so–provided that they are safe for a nurse’s specific duties!

Cowboy boots are a comfortable, stylish footwear option that shows solidarity with a team and traditional country values. While nurses need to consider the safety of themselves and their patients–as well as their professional expectations–there is no reason why nurses should not wear cowboy boots if they can perform their job well in them.

As individuals, nurses should decide whether cowboy boots are the best fit for them. However, especially in rural areas where cowboy boots are the norm, these boots can help nurses create a meaningful connection with their patients by sharing the local style and make nurses feel stylish even on the most hectic days. As long as the dress code does not forbid cowboy boots or similar shoes, nurses should feel free to enjoy wearing their favorite cowboy boots.

The only consideration that may be worth taking before wearing cowboy boots to work is that nursing can be a messy, fast-paced profession. As long as you are comfortable knowing that bodily fluids will almost certainly find their way onto your precious boots and you will almost certainly eventually have to run in these boots, knock yourself out!

What kind of cowboy boots would a nurse wear?

A nurse would most likely want to find cowboy boots with a low heel, slip-resistant sole, and comfortable material.

Nurses should also, as we mentioned earlier, consult with the appropriate staff to ensure that cowboy boots are permitted in their work setting. Also, avoiding dress cowboy boots for nursing work is probably best.

What areas of the U.S. are cowboy boots in hospitals acceptable?

While Texas is the most permissive state when it comes to cowboy boots–when everyone else is wearing them, how could they forbid nurses from doing the same?--other states have been known to accept cowboy boots in hospitals.

Rural hospitals tend to favor cowboy boots more than urban areas. This might be a cultural difference or a style difference. Whatever the reason, as long as your hospital does not forbid cowboy boots or features on cowboy boots such as a heel, it does not matter what others think. Cowboy boots are a tool of personal expression. As long as it is not hurting anyone or tarnishing your professional reputation, hold your head high and sport cowboy boots if that is what you want to do.

Final Thoughts

In short, nurses can wear cowboy boots in certain settings and places. In places where they are allowed, nurses can wear cowboy boots with scrubs. Whether nurses should be wearing cowboy boots is entirely up to the individual and the employer. A nurse would wear comfortable, slip-resistant, low-heeled cowboy boots. Cowboy boots are most acceptable in rural areas and states with large country-dwelling populations, such as Texas.

entry.title: Can you wear cowboy boots hunting? (Explained)
entry.summary: Should you wear cowboy boots while hunting? If you buy the correct brand and model, yes. Many pairs of cowboy boots are not suited for hunting; however, there are some models that are. Examples include Thorogood Men's Snake Boots and Ariat Men's Groundbreaker Square toe…
entry.content:
Should you wear cowboy boots while hunting?

If you buy the correct brand and model, yes. Many pairs of cowboy boots are not suited for hunting; however, there are some models that are. Examples include Thorogood Men's Snake Boots and Ariat Men's Groundbreaker Square toe Word Boot. There are also Rocky Men's Lynx Waterproof Snake Hunting Boot and HISEA Apollo Pro 400G Insulated Men's Hunting Boots. See, you do have options!

 

Are cowboy boots good for hunting?

In the past, there were not any options for this. Today they make cowboy boots for multiple purposes. It is possible to buy them in a style and look that are attractive while still using them for an activity such as hunting. Nowadays, there are choices.

Keep in mind that, when you go hunting, it typically involves hiking through rocky, wooded terrain. If you were dressy cowboy boots, you will not get around so well. You need a brand and model of boot that is better for hunting trips.

 

Are leather boots OK for hunting?

They are if you buy the right ones. If you buy a stylish-looking pair of leather cowboy boots with narrow toe area and a higher heel, do not attempt to go hunting in those. If you ignore our advice, you will be miserable. This style of boot is not good for things like that.

As we said, in today's boot market, there are varieties of leather cowboy boots that are fine for hunting or other outdoor activities. Expect to have to clean these boots after every hunting trip or other outdoor event. Otherwise, dirt and mud will get caked up on the boots and ruin them.

 

Is there a difference amongst boot types?

In reality, yes. There are boots make for formal events and those made for night-life. There are some made for hiking and some made for hunting. Then you can find boots suitable to work in. Cowboy boot makers have adjusted to this though. More and more makers are creating models that are multi-functional.

These specific boot crafters recognized the need for multipurpose cowboy boots and set out to accommodate this need. We would say they have succeeded. There are probably hundreds of versions on the market today. You will discover some that you can use for an activity such as hunting and not worry. Make sure you try them on before buying them to ensure they are comfortable.

 

Why would you wear cowboy boots while hunting?

There are some people, both men and women, who insist on wearing cowboy boots for every occasion. They are usually boot aficionados who know which kind to buy for which purpose. These folks will always find just the right pair of boots.

While sites like ours can make suggestions, it is really up to the individual to decide what to buy. If they choose to wear cowboy boots hunting, who is going to stop them. There really is no such thing as fashion police. Who cares what other people think anyhow. If you want to do this, go right ahead!

 

What are snake-proof cowboy boots?

In reality, there is no such thing. While leather cowboy boots will protect the bottom of your feet from snake bites, they do not from bites on the top and side of your feet. If you are within prime striking distance of a snake, it is possible for the bite to pierce the leather. Truth be told, you are best off wearing a boot with a tougher material that is better for evading snakes when you go hunting. Save your cowboy boots for other uses.

 

Can women wear cowboy boots when hunting?

Really, the same answer applies as it does to men. She should select pairs specifically geared towards rugged activity. She will want to visit a store that focuses on the many styles of cowboy boots. This is her best opportunity to find what she needs.

 

Advice for men and women about this topic

As we mentioned earlier, it is important to go to a physical store to look for these. You can tell the salesperson exactly what you want and try each pair on until you strike gold. If you intend to go hunting often, perhaps by more than one pair as long as you are at the store. A person cannot own too many pairs of cowboy boots!

 

Final thoughts

In the end, it is your feet we are talking about. If you really want to wear cowboy boots on hunting trips, we aren't going to tell you not to. In this case, do not expect the boots to last very long though. They will undergo a lot of punishment on hunting and hiking trips. It is also your money. If you want to shell it out for scores of pairs of boots, by all means do it!

entry.content:
Can you wear cowboy boots with a black suit?

Yes! In fact, you can wear cowboy boots with any color suit. Years ago the answer would have been no. However, the times have changed and so have fashion trends. The key in any of these instances is to pick the appropriate color. Want more information? Then keep reading this article.

Your cowboy boot collection

Ideally, you should have a large collection of cowboy boots. It ought to contain one of every major color and style. This is so you have an appropriate pair to wear with every color suit as well as with almost any other items of clothing and for the appropriate occasion.

Listing of various colors of cowboy boots with the right color suits

Dressy black cowboy boots

  • Light gray
  • Gray
  • Black
  • Charcoal color
  • Light blue

Dressy tan cowboy boots

  • Light gray
  • Tan
  • Brown
  • Navy
  • Other shades of blue
  • black

Dressy brown cowboy boots

  • Brown
  • Tan
  • Navy
  • Other shades of blue
  • Gray
  • Light gray
  • Charcoal
  • Black

So, what would happen if I ignored these rules?

In reality, nothing! Fashion rules are merely suggestions. It is not like the fashion police are going to arrest you for wearing other combinations. You might get laughed at, but who cares, right? This is still a free country, wear whatever you want! Enjoy your boots!

Should you wear cowboy boots with a black suit?

As we said, nowadays, cowboy boots can be worn with just about anything including a black suit. In the past, they were not considered formal enough to wear with such an outfit. Today, with the hundreds of colors and styles on the market, it is possible to own the perfect pair to go with your black suit or any other color suit.

More thoughts on this topic

Picture this! You in your black suit with a freshly-shined pair of black, tan, or brown dressy cowboy boots. My, how handsome you will look. You will be the envy of most other men.

What would happen if my boots were not shined?

You would look ridiculous! It would ruin the entire outfit. You usually know when you are going to need to wear your cowboy boots. Therefore, you have more than enough time to shine them and get them ready, not to mention to choose the best color for the suit or dress. Shine them!

Brown Cowboy boots with black suit

Some so-called fashion gurus frown upon this combination. We disagree! We think it is a stunning combination, especially if the brown cowboy boots include a spiffy design. Think about how handsome that is! Try adding a brown tie and accessories to compliment those brown boots. Marvelous!

Can women wear cowboy boots with dresses?

In today's times, yes she can. Again, she should select the appropriate color and style to go with the dress she is wearing. She also needs to make sure her boots are clean and shiny. Cowboy boot polish is for women to use as well as men.

Can a man wear cowboy boots with a tuxedo?

Yes you can, as long as you choose a pair that is equally-elegant in style. Since you would wear a tux to a very formal occasion, your cowboy boots need to be just as formal. Pick a pair with an intricate stitching pattern and a suitable color to go with your tux and other accessories.

What should you NEVER wear with cowboy boots?

Even in 2022, there are still some items of clothing you should not wear with cowboy boots. Please note: some people say you cannot wear with fringe and sequins with cowboy boots. We beg to differ. If you have ever seen people in parades with such outfits, they proudly wear cowboy boots. They look absolutely amazing. Therefore, we say go ahead and wear this combination! So, what are the thing you shouldn't wear with them? Here is our list.

  • Overalls
  • Prairie dresses
  • Athletic-styled clothes
  • Too many accessories, instead pick one or two nice pieces
  • Wedding dresses and bridal party dresses
  • Sportswear
  • Lace dresses or skirts

Final Thoughts

Once again, the points we have illustrated here are really suggestions even though fashion experts deem them to be rules. In the end, it is up to you to decide what to wear. Who knows, maybe you will be the person to start a new fashion trend. Wear your cowboy boots and be happy!

entry.title: Can I wear cowboy boots on a plane? (Explained)
entry.summary: You have an important flight coming up. After planning out accommodations for your arrival, buying your ticket, and packing all your luggage, a question still nags at you. You want to wear some cowboy boots for your trip, but can you? In this article, we’ll…
entry.content:
You have an important flight coming up. After planning out accommodations for your arrival, buying your ticket, and packing all your luggage, a question still nags at you. You want to wear some cowboy boots for your trip, but can you? In this article, we’ll discuss the details surrounding this traditional type of footwear when going through checkout and flight.

Should I wear cowboy boots on a plane?

That’s up to you.

It’s not so much a matter of whether you should or not, but if you’re allowed to. The TSA themselves stated that all boots and shoes are allowed on planes, so if you want to rock the boots of a cowboy, go right ahead! However, if there’s any steel or metal inside your boots, it’s more than likely that TSA agents will ask you to remove your footwear while passing through check out.

One exception is if your boots have something dangerous on them, such as decorative metal spikes. Anything that the TSA deems as a sharp object might require you to pack your boots with checked luggage.

Why would I wear cowboy boots on a plane?

Some say it’s more comfortable.

Chances are that flights will take hours on end to get from one place to another. It helps to have footwear that you can keep on the entire way. Some sources say that cowboy boots are more comfortable than any other shoe.

It’s also important to note that keeping on any kind of boot or shoe will make your feet stinky and sweaty. Cowboy boots are known to avoid this problem, and will simply smell like “leather” no matter how long you wear them for.

Can airline pilots wear cowboy boots?

Pilot dress codes usually don’t permit them.

Most pilots today have to abide by an approved uniform rule that doesn’t allow cowboy boots or “Stetsons” while flying. This wasn’t the case before the 1930's, where wearing boots would’ve been the norm for most pilots.

The present-day rule, however, was formed under a “Collective Bargaining Agreement,” with most airline companies signing on. It’s possible that there’s a pilot or two that will wear cowboy boots, just don’t expect to see them anytime soon.

Can you wear cowboy boots anywhere?

You can, but for some places it might seem inappropriate.

When out in public, no police officer will stop and demand that you change your boots for something else. You may, however, receive lots of attention by wearing cowboy boots. When doing so, it helps to wear other cowboy things as well to get the best western look possible.

As for major events, such as weddings and romantic evenings with a significant other, wearing such boots will be accepted by a majority of people. Heck, some events even expect you to wear cowboy boots, especially for country concerts, and anything involving horses.

As we established already, it’s also okay to wear cowboy boots inside airports and onboard planes. However, some events where you should avoid wearing them include:

  • Modern clubs (unless western-themed, avoid wearing cowboy gear)
  • Theater functions
  • Political events
  • Dates (unless your SO is okay with cowboy wear)

The fact of the matter is, wearing cowboy boots sends a bold message, and you’ll need a hefty amount of confidence to pull off the look in full. If you simply don’t care, go ahead and wear them anyway, just be mindful of your purpose of wearing cowboy boots in the first place.

Will you have any problems going through TSA if you’re wearing cowboy boots?

You shouldn’t, unless there’s a lot of metal inside them.

Some claim that wearing cowboy boots makes it easier to go through TSA checks due to the ability to slip them on and off with ease. Whether you’re asked to remove them or not is just about anyone’s guess. It depends on the agent and if there’s any metal within your footwear (you might set off the metal detectors).

Even if your cowboy boots are somewhat metallic, the TSA says it’s okay to travel with them on the plane, provided they don’t have any dangerous sharp accessories. Even if you have to remove them regardless, it won’t be much of a hassle to do so.

What are some good cowboy boot brands for wearing on a plane?

Pick ones that will keep you comfortable.

Some brands to consider include Justin and Old Gringo, but what’s even more important is that your boots are breathable so that your feet don’t end up sweating too much. Even though cowboy boots aren’t known to stink too often, it’s still uncomfortable to have your feet locked inside sweltering and hot footwear. Focus less on the brand of boots, and more on what feels good to walk around in.

In the off-chance that you’re expected to place your cowboy boots in checked luggage, you can use this helpful guide as how to pack them away without causing damage. This would be a good idea to consider well before arriving at the airport (check the rules online), so you don’t have to end up walking around in just your socks.

Final Thoughts

Everyone has their choice of style, and wearing cowboy boots on a plane won’t cause you much trouble. No matter where you’re going, be assured that your slick western footwear will follow you, even high in the sky.

entry.title: Can you wear brown boots with black cowboy hat? Explained!
entry.summary: The cowboy hat. It’s one of the most noticeable pieces of clothing out there. It shields the wearer from sun and rain, and also brings out the rugged coolness in just about anybody. Yet, are there unspoken rules for wearing one? In this article, we’ll…
entry.content:
The cowboy hat. It’s one of the most noticeable pieces of clothing out there. It shields the wearer from sun and rain, and also brings out the rugged coolness in just about anybody.

Yet, are there unspoken rules for wearing one? In this article, we’ll go over some dos and don’ts regarding the famous (and somewhat infamous) cowboy hat, other things you can wear to match it, and what certain hat colors can mean.

What are the rules regarding the color of cowboy hats?

Color won’t matter as much, but the rules of wearing cowboy hats will.

Unless specified by a unique group of cowboy hat wearers, feel free to wear any hat color you want. Traditionally, colors don’t mean much, and whatever color your hat is depends on personal preferences.

For hot summer days, you’ll be better off wearing a hat that’s a light color, so that most of the sun’s rays will reflect off your head. This will help cool your overall body temperature. In contrast, black hats absorb the most heat, inevitably warming you up the more sun you get.

Now, when it comes to cowboy hat behavior, there are a few unspoken rules you might be expected to follow. For example, if you’re attending church for any reason, take your hat off while inside the building.

If you live in the US, it’s considered respectful to also remove your hat during the Pledge of Allegiance, Passing of the Flag or during the National Anthem. In some areas, it’s polite for men to take their cowboy hats off (or simply tip them) when introducing themselves to a lady.

It’s also considered good manners to place your cowboy hat upside down whenever you take it off. The origins of this practice might be practical in nature, as placing it that way will prevent the brim from flattening and help maintain the hats' original shape.

What does a black cowboy hat symbolize?

In short, it can represent evil.

Traditional western films used white cowboy hats for good guys, while black cowboy hats were worn by the baddies. Even today's media has used the black cowboy hat to emphasize the evilness of just about any antagonist. Other popular bad guys such as Darth Vader and the Wicked Witch of the West also wore black headwear to represent their badness.

This isn’t to say you’ll become a villain in the eyes of others should you decide to wear one. In fact, the black cowboy hat is the most popular of its kind for both ladies and men.

Should you wear brown boots with a black cowboy hat?

You don’t have to, but the combination will work!

Either a black or white cowboy hat will match with just about any other color. If you want to rock a black hat and brown boots combo, go for it.

With that being said, it’s usually a good idea to avoid bright colors for your boots and other accessories such as your tie. You want some contrast, but anything too stark such as wearing bright red boots with your black cowboy hat will raise eyebrows.

Who should consider wearing brown boots with a black cowboy hat?

Anyone!

Unless the dress code at a formal gathering states otherwise, anyone can pull off brown boots and a black cowboy hat combination. The dark colors simply work well together in just about any setting.

However, for any event that has no western elements to speak of, it might be better to leave your hat and boots at home in favor of something else. You want to dress to impress. That’s understandable, but it also matters if you dress appropriately for the occasion.

Does cowboy hat color matter?

It depends on certain holidays and what else you wear.

As discussed before, the color can affect your body temperature depending on the season. Practicality aside, you can wear just about any cowboy hat color you choose, but pulling off a good look can become much harder the more western you want to appear.

In some cases, it’s more appropriate to wear white straw cowboy hats during Memorial Day through Labor Day. You’ll also fit in better if you wear a hat that corresponds to the color of your favorite sports team during a game.

When wearing other western-style clothes with your hat, the general rule of thumb is to compliment it with similar colors. Black cowboy hats will look better with darker colors, and vice versa when considering lighter colors. Remember the word compliment, meaning you want your outfit to stand out, but not too much (think bright neon colors or something equally weird).

Does a cowboy hat have to match the boots?

Not really, but it would be a good idea.

A black cowboy hat will go well with black cowboy boots, or even a brown pair. What’s more important, however, is the theme you’re trying to achieve. If you’re wearing a cowboy hat of any color in public, others will expect to see you wearing a slick pair of cowboy boots to match. These two items tend to go together like bread and butter, it’s simply how the get-up has come to be.

Final Thoughts

Cowboy etiquette can be important, but something even more crucial is matching your cowboy hat with appropriate colors and style. Aim to be admired, not mocked.

entry.summary: Cowboy Boots With Tuxedos An important event is coming up. You hear that formal wear is expected. Your mind starts racing with all kinds of clothes that you can choose. There’s a nice tuxedo hanging in your closet, and a pair of cowboy boots to…
entry.content:
Cowboy Boots With Tuxedos  

An important event is coming up.

You hear that formal wear is expected. Your mind starts racing with all kinds of clothes that you can choose.

There’s a nice tuxedo hanging in your closet, and a pair of cowboy boots to match.

Although, is pairing the two a good idea? In this article, we’ll take a look at the finer details of a tuxedo and boot combination, the dos and don’ts of wearing them, and some alternatives in the odd case that the attire you have in mind simply won’t work.

Should you wear cowboy boots while wearing a tuxedo?

It depends on where you’re going.

If the host of the event makes a strict note to not wear cowboy boots and/or a tuxedo, then choose another kind of outfit all-together. The question, however, is not so much if you should wear the combo or not, but if you can pull it off in the first place.

Generally, Tuxedos are known to be a special type of formal wear that require specific kinds of shoes. Anything from classy Oxfords to Calvin Klein Bernards are considered more appropriate matches for tuxedo suits. This isn’t to say that you can’t wear cowboy boots at all when rocking a tux, just know that other kinds of footwear might be more appropriate depending on the event you’re attending.

If you want to try the tux and cowboy boot combination anyway, the number one thing you should avoid is bright colors, especially if certain accessories are in contrast to one another. For example, if your tuxedo is black, don’t pair it with bright red boots. Instead, have your footwear match your suit. Black boots, especially polished to a sleek glossy shine, will pair best with a black tuxedo.

If it’s available near you, the best match for cowboy boots is the famous western tuxedo.

Prominent figures such as former US President George Bush Sr. were known to rock this combination in public.

To do this yourself, it’s important to take a detailed look at what’s considered the full western tuxedo appearance. In addition to your cowboy boots, you may also need a black cowboy hat and an over-sized belt buckle.

Also, putting on a pair of "boot-cut" jeans on top of all that wouldn’t be a bad idea either. If the western appearance is your ideal go-to, then it doesn’t hurt to go all out with it.

However, this get-up might not be appropriate for all formal gatherings. However, if you live in the southern US or a similar area, then don’t worry about wearing a tux and cowboy boots.

When should you consider wearing cowboy boots with a tuxedo?

Location, location, location.

This will sound like a repeated piece of advice, but where the event is being held can make all the difference in what you pick to wear. If the event you’re attending is a formal wedding, and it has no western themes to speak of, then it’s best that you pick other kinds of footwear other than cowboy boots.

Another example would be attending a fancy ball. The cultural clash of western and classy gala won’t mix well, and you’ll be getting the wrong kind of attention. If necessary, study the local fashion of where you’ll be going. You’re dressing to impress after all.

However, if you’re in Texas or anywhere similar, then wearing both the tux and boots might be expected. For formal events in these areas, it’s common to have a "black tie and boots" dress code.

Remember the earlier advice recommending you avoid using bright colors? Well, it can matter, especially with men wearing slick tuxedos and polished cowboy boots. That’s right, these kinds of events expect your boots to shine like a brand-new mirror. So, regardless of which cowboy boots you pick to wear, give them a solid cleaning and polish before you head out.

What brand of boots goes well with a black tuxedo?

There are many types, but the more important thing is giving your footwear a clean look.

To be even more specific, polish your boots so well that you can see your face in them better than in your bathroom mirror. For any small scratches, you might be able to use shoe cream as a quick-fix, but if your footwear is made of other materials besides calfskin, it’ll be much harder to buff out any unsightly marks.

To compliment the tuxedo look, especially a western-style, consider getting a pair of boots made from cowhide, caiman, or lizard. Bonus points if you can find any in glossy black.

It’s also recommended that you avoid using any brown cowboy boots. The reasoning goes back to when we talked about the need to avoid bright colors. The exception in this case would be pairing them with a nice brown tuxedo to match. What we’re trying to avoid are things that contrast and stand out to one another. It’s better if you match the tux and boot colors.

Final Thoughts

So, as a quick recap, don’t ignore the possibility that you’ll need different footwear altogether, avoid bright colors, and match your boots with whatever tux you decide on using. Accessories such as a tie should match the boots and suit as well.

Whatever you choose, keep a clean appearance. Don’t be afraid to add a bit of extra polish and elbow grease as well.
